climbs.name: Unlimited Choss......and Breadsticks
climbs.fa: Luke Bertelsen, Kemper Brightman, Tiffany Bertelsen - 2016

content.description:
The crux of this route is not wandering left into the land of choss.  Start out with good holds for the first two bolts and then things get a little cryptic. 

  Keep it together and you will find yourself grabbing giant crystals just below the chains.

climbs.name: Obsessive Cleaning Disorder
climbs.fa: Luke Bertelsen, Kemper Brightman, Tiffany Bertelsen - 2016

content.description:
Begin left of the giant choss crack and gradually trend right.  You will actually stem across the crack for the first several bolts before you are kicked out on the white face for the final half of the route.   

  This line isn't much of a looker, but there are some fun holds and challenging moves up there.
content.location: Second route right of the prominent corner.

content.description: The start is stout and you will know it is a 5.10 right away.  Find the jug at the base of the bush before clipping the third bolt for a easy clip. Casual climbing leads to a steep finish in and around a crack. Stemming and a fingerlock or two will keep it fun to the end. Great to be climbing and putting up routes with a friend of 40 years who wrote the original guidebook to Mount Lemmon.
content.protection: 9 bolts to steel lower off carabiners
content.location: Just left of Obsessive Cleaning Disorder and right of the corner.

climbs.name: 90 Days in the Hole
climbs.fa: Luke Bertelsen, Kemper Brightman, Tiffany Bertelsen - 2016

content.description:
This route has one of the most interesting holds I have ever grabbed on Mt. Lemmon.   

  If you do choose to put your entire arm into the football shaped hueco I can let you know that I was not able to reach the back and that I am not certain something does not live in it. 

  Start out with chunky holds in the crack on your way to the bottomless hueco.  Do some awesome moves to and from the hueco and continue climbing up the pillar to the chains.

This small cluster of 4 routes is found on a ledge up and right from The Draw Pile.Developers were certain this cliff would yield more than three routes, but alas there is A LOT of choss. A LOT is actually an understatement. If you stray too far off of the bolt lines you are sure to see why this cliff earned the name "The Discard Pile".
